dialog.name: sort
dialog.whatsthis:
Allows you to select the first column to sort by.

Click Ascending to sort the lowest number, or the beginning of the alphabet first in the sorted list. Blank cells are always sorted first.

Click Descending to sort the highest number, or the end of the alphabet first in the sorted list. Blank cells are always sorted last.

Use these boxes if you are sorting by more than one column. After the list is sorted by the column specified in the Sort By box, the list is sorted by additional columns in sequence.

Click Ascending to sort the lowest number, or the beginning of the alphabet first in the sorted list. Blank cells are always sorted first.

Click Descending to sort the highest number, or the end of the alphabet first in the sorted list. Blank cells are always sorted last.

dialog.name: update_initial_memory
dialog.whatsthis: Specifies the format of the memory initialization (.mem) file.
Fills the EBR memory with all 1s instead of using the values in the .mem file.
Fills the EBR memory with all 0s instead of using the values in the .mem file.

Specifies the memory initialization (.mem) file for the selected memory block. Click the ... button to browse to the file. The .mem file contains initial values for memory components such as RAM and ROM blocks.

Specifies the Lattice Semiconductor parameter configuration (.lpc) file, which contains the configuration parameters that you selected in IPexpress. This box automatically specifies the .lpc file included in the current design directory. If your .lpc file is stored outside the design directory, click the ... button to browse to the file.
Displays the memory parameters contained in the .lpc file.
Lists all the memory module components in the selected memory block and their placement information.
Updates the current memory block's initial memory values. A message will appear telling you whether the initialization succeeds or not.

dialog.name: update_ufm_parameters
dialog.whatsthis:
Enabled - Initializes the memory with all zeros.

Disabled - Initializes the memory with the memory initialization (.mem) file that you specify in the UFM Initialization Data File box.
Specifies the format of the memory initialization (.mem) file that you specify in the UFM Initialization Data File box.

Specifies the memory initialization (.mem) file for initializing the UFM. Click the ... button to browse to the file.

The default place where Lattice Diamond searches for the UFM initialization file is the project implementation directory. If the initialization file you specify is not in the implementation directory, ECO Editor will copy it to the implementation directory and inform you the file is copied.

Occupied UFM Pages - Shows the size of the memory in pages with 128 bits/page.

Initialization Data Starts at Page - Shows the page that the initialization data will start at. This location depends on the Occupied UFM Pages and the size of the flash memory available in the selected device.
Updates the UFM's initial memory values. A message will appear telling you whether the initialization succeeds or not.
